Welcome to TextGame’s documentation!¶

GameState¶

class TextGame.GameState.GameState¶

Namespace class that manages game-global attributes.

Damage_types

List[str] - Types of damage available for weapon damage and armor resistance.

Actors

List[ActorUnit] - List of active entities in the game.

Round_count

int - Combat turns taken.

Player_actor

ActorUnit - Reference to the ActorUnit representing the player.

Is_active_game

bool - Flag variable. Determined at start of turn cycle if player HP is 0.

Nonfree_action_taken

Bool - Flag variable. Used to determine whether hostile entities get to act.

Enemy_count

int - Counts the number of active enemy combatants for the purpose of determining whether player is in combat.

Shop_inventory

Inventory - Reference to the Inventory representing the current shop.

GameObject¶

class TextGame.GameObject.GameObject¶

Namespace class that manages game-global methods.

static round() → None¶

Takes turns sequentially for each actor.

static start_game() → None¶

Static method for initializing the game state.

Events¶

class TextGame.Events.Events¶

Container class for game events. Used for namespace cleanliness.

static generate_enemy(is_boss: bool = False) → None¶

Generates an enemy actor with stats scaled with GameObject.turn_count.

Parameters

is_boss – Controls whether to spawn a standard mob or a boss mob.

static random_event() → bool¶

Rolls for a random game event.

Returns

True if event occurs, otherwise returns False.

ActorUnit¶

class TextGame.ActorUnit.ActorUnit(name: str = 'default', health: int = 1, starter_weapon: TextGame.Weapon.Weapon = Weapon(name:Fists, _dmg:1, durability_max: 999, _durability: 999, hit_mod: 0, dmg_type: Bludgeoning, is_ranged: False, tier: Common), starter_armor: TextGame.Armor.Armor = Armor(name:Loincloth, durability_max:99999, _durability:99999, _resistances:[], _defense:2, AC:5))¶

Represents any and all controllable and non-controllable entities.

property health¶

Getter for _health.

Returns

_health property of ActorUnit instance.

static unit_count() → int¶

Getter for the amount of ActorUnit instances alive.

Returns

Unit count stored in class (not per-instance).

Armor¶

class TextGame.Armor.Armor(name: str = 'default', durability: int = 99999, resistances=None, defense: int = 0, armor_class: int = 0, tier: str = 'Common')¶

Armor item class.

add_resistance(new_resistance: str)¶
static create_common_armor(scaling: int)¶
static create_legendary_armor(scaling: int)¶
static create_mythic_armor(scaling: int)¶
static create_rare_armor(scaling: int)¶
static create_uncommon_armor(scaling: int)¶
property defense¶
property durability¶
static gen_armor(scaling: int) → TextGame.Armor.Armor¶

Generates armor with random tiers and stats.

Common-70%, 78% before scaling>40

Uncommon-15%, 18.5% before scaling>70

Rare-8% after scaling>40, 10.5% before scaling>100

Legendary-4.5% after scaling>70

Mythical-2.5% after scaling>100

Parameters

scaling – Scaling variable that controls the stat generation. Plus/Minus 0.1*scaling*(random()-0.5)

Returns

Generated Armor.

property resistances¶
static unit_count() → int¶

Getter for the amount of Weapon instances alive.

Returns

_instance_count

Weapon¶

class TextGame.Weapon.Weapon(name: str = 'default', damage: float = 1, durability: int = 999, hit_modifier: int = 0, damage_type: str = 'Bludgeoning', is_ranged: bool = False, tier: str = 'Common')¶

Class for weapon items.

property dmg¶

Getter for _dmg with logic for broken weapons.

Returns

If durability is 0, returns 1, otherwise returns _dmg.

property durability¶

Getter for _durability.

Returns

_durability.

static gen_weapon(scaling: int) → TextGame.Weapon.Weapon¶

Generates weapons with random tiers and stats.

Common-70%, 78% before scaling>40

Uncommon-15%, 18.5% before scaling>70

Rare-8% after scaling>40, 10.5% before scaling>100

Legendary-4.5% after scaling>70

Mythical-2.5% after scaling>100

Parameters

scaling – Scaling variable that controls the stat generation. Plus/Minus 0.1*scaling*(random()-0.5)

Returns

Generated Weapon.

static unit_count() → int¶

Getter for the amount of Weapon instances alive.

Returns

_instance_count
